<div class="projectSection" style="--bg-color: #9fcffa">
 <div class="projectTitle">
  Machine Learning in Pharmacometric modeling
 </div>
 <div class="projectItems">
  <div class="projectItem" style="--wd:30%">
   <div class="projectItemTitle">
   RNNs
   </div>
   <a href="https://ascpt.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/psp4.12874"><img class="projectItemImage" src="rnn_publication.png"/></a>
   <div class="projectItemDescription">
   This work describes how Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs) can learn pharmacokinetic concentration-time profiles. <a href="rnns.html">Read more &#8594;</a>
   </div>
  </div>
  <div class="projectItem" style="--wd:30%">
   <div class="projectItemTitle">
   NODEs
   </div>
   <a href="https://ascpt.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/psp4.12874"><img class="projectItemImage" src="nodes_publication.png"/></a>
   <div class="projectItemDescription">
   In this work, we developed Neural Ordinary Differential Equation (NODE) architecture - so called low-dimensional NODEs - to fit pharmacometric data. <a href="nodes.html">Read more &#8594;</a>
   </div>
  </div>
  <div class="projectItem" style="--wd:30%">
   <div class="projectItemTitle">
   pmxNODEs
   </div>
   <a href="pmxnodes.html"><img class="projectItemImage" src="pmxnodes_publication_prov.png"/></a>
   <div class="projectItemDescription">
   Here, we integrated the NODEs in commonly used pharmacometric software, such as Monolix, NONMEM, and nlmixr2 and we developed an R package to facilitate the integration. <a href="nodes.html">Read more &#8594;</a>
   </div>
  </div>
 </div>
</div>

<div class="projectSection" style="--bg-color: lightgreen">
 <div class="projectTitle">
  Advances in the Pharmacometric workflow
 </div>
 <div class="projectItems">
  <div class="projectItem" style="--wd:45%">
   <div class="projectItemTitle">
   Imputation
   </div>
   <a href="https://ascpt.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/psp4.12874"><img class="projectItemImage" src="imputation_publication.png"/></a>
   <div class="projectItemDescription">
   In this work, we present how machine learning can be leveraged to impute missing covariate data in a pharmacometric dataset. <a href="imputation.html">Read more &#8594;</a>
   </div>
  </div>
  <div class="projectItem" style="--wd:45%">
   <div class="projectItemTitle">
   Dose finding
   </div>
   <a href="dose_finding.html"><img class="projectItemImage" src="dose_publication.png"/></a>
   <div class="projectItemDescription">
   Here, we leverage optimal control in combination with mixed-effects modeling to find the therapeutic doses for a population. <a href="dose_finding.html">Read more &#8594;</a>
   </div>
  </div>
 </div>
</div>
